Title: Running Scared
Consensus: Running Scared struggles to strike a consistent balance between violent action and humor, but the chemistry between its well-matched leads keeps things entertaining.
Cast: Gregory Hines, Billy Crystal, Jimmy Smits, Steven Bauer
Synopsis: Ray and Danny (Gregory Hines, Billy Crystal) are two Chicago police detectives hot on the trail of drug kingpin Julio...

Title: Equilibrium
Consensus: Equilibrium is a reheated mishmash of other sci-fi movies.
Cast: Christian Bale, Emily Watson, Taye Diggs, Angus Macfadyen
Synopsis: In a futuristic world, a regime has eliminated war by suppressing emotions: books, art and music are strictly forbidden and...

Title: Hero
Consensus: With death-defying action sequences and epic historic sweep, Hero offers everything a martial arts fan could ask for.
Cast: Jet Li, Tony Leung Chiu Wai, Maggie Cheung Man-yuk, Donnie Yen
Synopsis: In this visually arresting martial arts epic set in ancient China, an unnamed fighter (Jet Li) is being honored for...

Title: Road House
Consensus: Whether Road House is simply bad or so bad it's good depends largely on the audience's fondness for Swayze -- and tolerance for violently cheesy action.
Cast: Patrick Swayze, Kelly Lynch, Sam Elliott, Ben Gazzara
Synopsis: The Double Deuce is the meanest, loudest and rowdiest bar south of the Mason-Dixon Line, and Dalton (Patrick Swayze) has...

Title: Unstoppable
Consensus: As fast, loud, and relentless as the train at the center of the story, Unstoppable is perfect popcorn entertainment -- and director Tony Scott's best movie in years.
Cast: Denzel Washington, Chris Pine, Rosario Dawson, Kevin Dunn
Synopsis: When a massive, unmanned locomotive roars out of control, the threat is more ominous than just a derailment. The train...

Title: Shaft
Consensus: This is the man that would risk his neck for his brother, man. Can you dig it?
Cast: Richard Roundtree, Moses Gunn, Christopher St. John, Charles Cioffi
Synopsis: John Shaft (Richard Roundtree) is the ultimate in suave black detectives. He first finds himself up against Bumpy (Moses Gunn),...

Title: The Villainess
Consensus: The Villainess offers enough pure kinetic thrills to satisfy genre enthusiasts -- and carve out a bloody niche for itself in modern Korean action cinema.
Cast: Kim Ok-bin, Shin Ha-kyun, Sung Joon, Kim Seo-hyung
Synopsis: Honed from childhood to be an elite assassin, Sook-hee embarks on a rampage of violence and revenge to finally earn...

Title: Highlander
Consensus: People hate Highlander because it's cheesy, bombastic, and absurd. And people love it for the same reasons.
Cast: Christopher Lambert, Sean Connery, Roxanne Hart, Clancy Brown
Synopsis: When the mystical Russell Nash (Christopher Lambert) kills a man in a sword fight in a New York City parking...

Title: Die Hard 2
Consensus: It lacks the fresh thrills of its predecessor, but Die Hard 2 still works as an over-the-top -- and reasonably taut -- big-budget sequel, with plenty of set pieces to paper over the plot deficiencies.
Cast: Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, William Atherton, Reginald VelJohnson
Synopsis: A year after his heroics in L.A, detective John McClane (Bruce Willis) is mixed up in another terrorist plot, this...

Title: National Treasure
Consensus: National Treasure is no treasure, but it's a fun ride for those who can forgive its highly improbable plot.
Cast: Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Justin Bartha, Sean Bean
Synopsis: Historian and code-breaker Ben Gates (Nicolas Cage) has been searching his whole life for a rumored treasure dating back to...

Title: The Protector
Consensus: Despite some impressive fight scenes, this trimmed-down version of the Thai action pic is an off-putting mix of scant plot, choppy editing, and confusing subtitles and dubbing.
Cast: Tony Jaa, Johnny Nguyen, Nathan Jones, Petchtai Wongkamlao
Synopsis: A young fighter (Tony Jaa) travels to Australia to retrieve stolen elephants that were promised originally to the king of...

Title: Revenge
Consensus: Revenge slices and dices genre tropes, working within an exploitation framework while adding a timely -- yet never less than viscerally thrilling -- feminist spin.
Cast: Matilda Lutz, Kevin Janssens, Vincent Colombe, Guillaume Bouchède
Synopsis: Jen is enjoying a romantic getaway with her wealthy boyfriend -- until his two sleazy friends arrive for an unannounced...

Title: El Mariachi
Consensus: Made on a shoestring budget, El Mariachi's story is not new. However, the movie has so much energy that it's thoroughly enjoyable.
Cast: Carlos Gallardo, Consuelo Gómez, Reinol Martinez, Peter Marquardt
Synopsis: El Mariachi (Carlos Gallardo) is a traveling guitar player with the modest desire to play music for a living. Looking...

Title: A Touch of Zen
Consensus: A brilliantly directed feast for the eyes with an epic story to match, A Touch of Zen marks a groundbreaking achievement in the wuxia genre.
Cast: Feng Hsu, Chun Shih, Pai Ying, Roy Chiao
Synopsis: Ku Shen Chai (Chun Shih), an unmotivated artist in his early 30s, still lives with his mother, but he is...

Title: Top Gun
Consensus: Though it features some of the most memorable and electrifying aereial footage shot with an expert eye for action, Top Gun offers too little for non-adolescent viewers to chew on when its characters aren't in the air.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Kelly McGillis, Anthony Edwards, Val Kilmer
Synopsis: The Top Gun Naval Fighter Weapons School is where the best of the best train to refine their elite flying...

Title: Con Air
Consensus: Con Air won't win any awards for believability - and all involved seem cheerfully aware of it, making some of this blockbuster action outing's biggest flaws fairly easy to forgive.
Cast: Nicolas Cage, John Cusack, John Malkovich, Steve Buscemi
Synopsis: Just-paroled army ranger Cameron Poe (Nicolas Cage) is headed back to his wife (Monica Potter), but must fly home aboard...

Title: The Expendables 2
Consensus: Taut, violent, and suitably self-deprecating, The Expendables 2 gives classic action fans everything they can reasonably expect from a star-studded shoot-'em-up -- for better and for worse.
Cast: Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham, Jet Li, Dolph Lundgren
Synopsis: Mercenary leader Barney Ross (Sylvester Stallone), Lee Christmas (Jason Statham) and the rest of the Expendables team reunite when Mr....

Title: The Mummy
Consensus: It's difficult to make a persuasive argument for The Mummy as any kind of meaningful cinematic achievement, but it's undeniably fun to watch.
Cast: Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo
Synopsis: The Mummy is a rousing, suspenseful and horrifying epic about an expedition of treasure-seeking explorers in the Sahara Desert in...

Title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
Consensus: Although this action-romance suffers from weak writing and one too many explosions, the chemistry generated by onscreen couple Pitt and Jolie is palpable enough to make this a thoroughly enjoyable summer action flick.
Cast: Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody
Synopsis: John (Brad Pitt) and Jane Smith (Angelina Jolie), a couple in a stagnating marriage, live a deceptively mundane existence. However,...

Title: Rush Hour
Consensus: A kick-ass addition to the cop-buddy film genre.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Chris Tucker, Tom Wilkinson, Elizabeth Peña
Synopsis: When a Chinese diplomat's daughter is kidnapped in Los Angeles, he calls in Hong Kong Detective Inspector Lee (Jackie Chan)...

Title: The Equalizer
Consensus: The Equalizer is more stylishly violent than meaningful, but with Antoine Fuqua behind the cameras and Denzel Washington dispensing justice, it delivers.
Cast: Denzel Washington, Marton Csokas, Chloë Grace Moretz, David Harbour
Synopsis: Robert McCall (Denzel Washington), a man of mysterious origin who believes he has put the past behind him, dedicates himself...

Title: Captain America: Civil War
Consensus: Captain America: Civil War begins the next wave of Marvel movies with an action-packed superhero blockbuster boasting a decidedly non-cartoonish plot and the courage to explore thought-provoking themes.
Cast: Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr., Scarlett Johansson, Sebastian Stan
Synopsis: Political pressure mounts to install a system of accountability when the actions of the Avengers lead to collateral damage. The...

Title: Air Force One
Consensus: This late-period Harrison Ford actioner is full of palpable, if not entirely seamless, thrills.
Cast: Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Wendy Crewson
Synopsis: After making a speech in Moscow vowing to never negotiate with terrorists, President James Marshall (Harrison Ford) boards Air Force...

Title: Bloodsport
Consensus: This is where it all began for the Muscles from Brussels, but beyond Van Damme's athleticism, Bloodsport is a cliched, virtually plotless exercise in action movie recycling.
Cast: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres, Norman Burton
Synopsis: U.S. soldier Frank Dux (Jean-Claude Van Damme) has come to Hong Kong to be accepted into the Kumite, a highly...

Title: Blade
Consensus: Though some may find the plot a bit lacking, Blade's action is fierce, plentiful, and appropriately stylish for a comic book adaptation.
Cast: Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff, Kris Kristofferson, N'Bushe Wright
Synopsis: A half-mortal, half-immortal is out to avenge his mother's death and rid the world of vampires. The modern-day technologically advanced...

Title: Bad Boys
Consensus: Bad Boys stars Will Smith and Martin Lawrence have enjoyable chemistry; unfortunately, director Michael Bay too often drowns it out with set pieces and explosions in place of an actual story.
Cast: Martin Lawrence, Will Smith, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo
Synopsis: Miami-Dade detectives Mike Lowrey (Will Smith) and Marcus Burnett (Martin Lawrence) blow a fuse when $100 million worth of heroin...

Title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
Consensus: Die Hard with a Vengeance benefits from Bruce Willis and Samuel L. Jackson's barbed interplay, but clatters to a bombastic finish in a vain effort to cover for an overall lack of fresh ideas.
Cast: Bruce Willis, Jeremy Irons, Samuel L. Jackson, Graham Greene
Synopsis: Detective John McClane (Bruce Willis) is now divorced, alcoholic and jobless after getting fired for his reckless behavior and bad...

Title: The Running Man
Consensus: The Running Man is winking sci-fi satire with ridiculous clothes and workmanlike direction.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Maria Conchita Alonso, Richard Dawson, Yaphet Kotto
Synopsis: In the year 2019, America is a totalitarian state where the favorite television program is "The Running Man" -- a...

Title: Code of Silence
Consensus: No consensus yet.
Cast: Chuck Norris, Henry Silva, Bert Remsen, Mike Genovese
Synopsis: In Chicago, honor-driven Sgt. Eddie Cusack (Chuck Norris) and his team stake out a drug exchange involving notorious drug czar...

Title: Shoot 'Em Up
Consensus: As preposterous and over-the-top as Shoot 'Em Up may be, its humor and non-stop action make for a very enjoyable film.
Cast: Clive Owen, Paul Giamatti, Monica Bellucci, Daniel Pilon
Synopsis: After saving a newborn infant from assassins, carrot-crunching gunman Mr. Smith (Clive Owen) teams up with a prostitute named DQ...

Title: Crank
Consensus: Crank's assaultive style and gleeful depravity may turn off casual action fans, but audiences seeking a strong dose of adrenaline will be thrilled by Jason Statham's raucous race against mortality.
Cast: Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Jose Pablo Cantillo, Efren Ramirez
Synopsis: Chev Chelios (Jason Statham), a hit man wanting to go straight, lets his latest target slip away, then he awakes...

Title: Machete
Consensus: Machete is messy, violent, shallow, and tasteless -- and that's precisely the point of one of the summer's most cartoonishly enjoyable films.
Cast: Danny Trejo, Robert De Niro, Jessica Alba, Steven Seagal

Title: Drive
Consensus: With its hyper-stylized blend of violence, music, and striking imagery, Drive represents a fully realized vision of arthouse action.
Cast: Ryan Gosling, Carey Mulligan, Bryan Cranston, Albert Brooks
Synopsis: Driver is a skilled Hollywood stuntman who moonlights as a getaway driver for criminals. Though he projects an icy exterior,...

Title: Batman
Consensus: An eerie, haunting spectacle, Batman succeeds as dark entertainment, even if Jack Nicholson's Joker too often overshadows the title character.
Cast: Jack Nicholson, Michael Keaton, Kim Basinger, Robert Wuhl
Synopsis: Having witnessed his parents' brutal murder as a child, millionaire philanthropist Bruce Wayne (Michael Keaton) fights crime in Gotham City...

Title: Under Siege
Consensus: A well-directed action thriller that makes the most of its confined setting, Under Siege marks a high point for early '90s action -- and its star's spotty filmography.
Cast: Steven Seagal, Tommy Lee Jones, Gary Busey, Erika Eleniak
Synopsis: A heroic loner takes on a group of nuclear terrorists in this seagoing tale. Posing as a rock band, the...

Title: Independence Day
Consensus: The plot is thin and so is character development, but as a thrilling, spectacle-filled summer movie, Independence Day delivers.
Cast: Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell
Synopsis: In the epic adventure film "Independence Day," strange phenomena surface around the globe. The skies ignite. Terror races through the...

Title: Bullitt
Consensus: Steve McQueen is cool as ice in this thrilling police procedural that also happens to contain arguably the greatest movie car chase ever.
Cast: Steve McQueen, Robert Vaughn, Jacqueline Bisset, Don Gordon
Synopsis: Senator Walter Chalmers (Robert Vaughn) is aiming to take down mob boss Pete Ross (Vic Tayback) with the help of...

Title: Wanted
Consensus: Wanted is stylish, energetic popcorn fare with witty performances from Angelina Jolie (playing an expert assassin), James McAvoy, and Morgan Freeman that help to distract from its absurdly over-the-top plot.
Cast: James McAvoy, Morgan Freeman, Angelina Jolie, Terence Stamp
Synopsis: Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is an office worker whose life is going nowhere. After his estranged father is murdered, he...

Title: Superman: The Movie
Consensus: Superman deftly blends humor and gravitas, taking advantage of the perfectly cast Christopher Reeve to craft a loving, nostalgic tribute to an American pop culture icon.
Cast: Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Marlon Brando, Margot Kidder
Synopsis: Just before the destruction of the planet Krypton, scientist Jor-El (Marlon Brando) sends his infant son Kal-El on a spaceship...

Title: Ronin
Consensus: Ronin earns comparisons to The French Connection with strong action, dynamic road chase scenes, and solid performances.
Cast: Robert De Niro, Jean Reno, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard
Synopsis: Deirdre (Natascha McElhone) puts together a team of experts that she tasks with stealing a valuable briefcase, the contents of...

Title: They Live
Consensus: A politically subversive blend of horror and sci fi, They Live is an underrated genre film from John Carpenter.
Cast: Roddy Piper, Keith David, Meg Foster, George "Buck" Flower
Synopsis: Nada (Roddy Piper), a wanderer without meaning in his life, discovers a pair of sunglasses capable of showing the world...

Title: Cliffhanger
Consensus: While it can't escape comparisons to the movies it borrows from, Cliffhanger is a tense, action-packed thriller and a showcase for the talents that made Sylvester Stallone a star.

Title: Marvel's the Avengers
Consensus: Thanks to a script that emphasizes its heroes' humanity and a wealth of superpowered set pieces, The Avengers lives up to its hype and raises the bar for Marvel at the movies.

Synopsis: When Thor's evil brother, Loki (Tom Hiddleston), gains access to the unlimited power of the energy cube called the Tesseract,...

Title: Hot Fuzz
Consensus: The brilliant minds behind Shaun of the Dead successfully take a shot at the buddy cop genre with Hot Fuzz. The result is a bitingly satiric and hugely entertaining parody.
Cast: Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, Jim Broadbent, Paddy Considine
Synopsis: As a former London constable, Nicholas Angel (Simon Pegg) finds if difficult to adapt to his new assignment in the...

Title: The Warriors
Consensus: As violent as it is stylish, The Warriors is a thrilling piece of pulp filmmaking.
Cast: Michael Beck, James Remar, Dorsey Wright, Brian Tyler
Synopsis: A turf battle between New York City street gangs that rages from Coney Island to the Bronx. The Warriors are...

Title: Starship Troopers
Consensus: A fun movie...if you can accept the excessive gore and wooden acting.
Cast: Casper Van Dien, Dina Meyer, Denise Richards, Jake Busey
Synopsis: In the distant future, the Earth is at war with a race of giant alien insects. Little is known about...

Title: Elite Squad 2
Consensus: Elite Squad: The Enemy Within is a bleak, violent descent into the Brazilian underbelly, ripping into the favelas with unstoppable and kinetic force.
Cast: Wagner Moura, Irandhir Santos, André Ramiro, Pedro Van-Held
Synopsis: Dirty cops and corrupt, powerful politicians threaten Nascimento (Wagner Moura)....

Title: Point Break
Consensus: Absurd, over-the-top, and often wildly entertaining, Point Break is here to show you that the human spirit is still alive.
Cast: Patrick Swayze, Keanu Reeves, Gary Busey, Lori Petty
Synopsis: After a string of bizarre bank robberies in Southern California, with the crooks donning masks of various former presidents, a...

Title: The Long Kiss Goodnight
Consensus: Smart, sharp-witted, and fueled by enjoyably over-the-top action, The Long Kiss Goodnight makes up in impact what it lacks in consistent aim.
Cast: Geena Davis, Samuel L. Jackson, Patrick Malahide, Craig Bierko
Synopsis: Schoolteacher and single mother Samantha Caine (Geena Davis) lives an average suburban life -- until she begins having strange memories...

Title: The Guest
Consensus: Boasting enough intelligence to bolster its darkly violent thrills, The Guest offers another treat for genre fans from director Adam Wingard.
Cast: Dan Stevens, Maika Monroe, Leland Orser, Sheila Kelley
Synopsis: A string of mysterious deaths leads a teenager to become suspicious of a soldier (Dan Stevens) who showed up on...

Title: Taken
Consensus: Taken is undeniably fun with slick action, but is largely a brainless exercise.
Cast: Liam Neeson, Maggie Grace, Famke Janssen, Leland Orser
Synopsis: Bryan Mills (Liam Neeson), a former government operative, is trying to reconnect with his daughter, Kim (Maggie Grace). Then his...

Consensus: A simple-minded but visually exciting experience, full of blood, violence, and ready-made movie quotes.
Cast: Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, David Wenham, Dominic West

Title: True Lies
Consensus: If it doesn't reach the heights of director James Cameron's and star Arnold Schwarzenegger's previous collaborations, True Lies still packs enough action and humor into its sometimes absurd plot to entertain.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jamie Lee Curtis, Tom Arnold, Bill Paxton
Synopsis: Secretly a spy but thought by his family to be a dull salesman, Harry Tasker (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is tracking down...

Title: Demolition Man
Consensus: A better-than-average sci-fi shoot-em-up with a satirical undercurrent, Demolition Man is bolstered by strong performances by Sylvester Stallone, Wesley Snipes, and Sandra Bullock.

Title: Hardcore Henry
Consensus: Hardcore Henry seems poised to reinvent the action flick, but without a story or characters worth caring about, its first-person gimmick quickly loses its thrill.
Cast: Sharlto Copley, Danila Kozlovsky, Haley Bennett, Dasha Charusha
Synopsis: A man wakes up in a Moscow laboratory to learn that he's been brought back from the dead as a...

Title: Police Story
Consensus: Blending brilliant physical comedy with thrillingly choreographed set pieces, Police Story makes a persuasive case for Jackie Chan as one of the all-time genre greats.

Synopsis: A kung-fu policeman (Jackie Chan) must protect a female witness (Brigitte Lin) from a Hong Kong drug lord for whom...

Title: Brotherhood of the Wolf
Consensus: Brotherhood of the Wolf mixes its genres with little logic, but the end result is wildly entertaining.
Cast: Samuel Le Bihan, Mark Dacascos, Émilie Dequenne, Vincent Cassel

Title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
Consensus: Stylish, subversive, and above all fun, Kingsman: The Secret Service finds director Matthew Vaughn sending up the spy genre with gleeful abandon.
Cast: Colin Firth, Michael Caine, Taron Egerton, Samuel L. Jackson

Title: The Fifth Element
Consensus: Visually inventive and gleefully over the top, Luc Besson's The Fifth Element is a fantastic piece of pop sci-fi that never takes itself too seriously.

Synopsis: In the 23rd century, a New York City cabbie, Korben Dallas (Bruce Willis), finds the fate of the world in...

Title: Big Trouble in Little China
Consensus: Brimming with energy and packed with humor, Big Trouble in Little China distills kung fu B-movies as affectionately as it subverts them.
Cast: Kurt Russell, Kim Cattrall, Dennis Dun, James Hong

Title: Atomic Blonde
Consensus: Atomic Blonde gets enough mileage out of its stylish action sequences -- and ever-magnetic star -- to make up for a narrative that's somewhat less hard-hitting than its protagonist.
Cast: Charlize Theron, James McAvoy, Eddie Marsan, John Goodman
Synopsis: Sensual and savage, Lorraine Broughton is the most elite spy in MI6, an agent who's willing to use all of...

Title: Rumble in the Bronx
Consensus: An entertaining Jackie Chan stunt-fest in which the impressive action sequences overcome the low production value and by-the-numbers plot.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Anita Mui, Bill Tung, Françoise Yip
Synopsis: Hong Kong policeman Keung (Jackie Chan) arrives in New York for the wedding of his uncle Bill (Bill Tung), a...

Title: District B13
Consensus: A nonstop thrill ride, District B13's dizzying action sequences more than make up for any expository flaws.
Cast: Cyril Raffaelli, David Belle, Tony D'Amario, Larbi Naceri

Title: Beverly Hills Cop
Consensus: The buddy cop movie continues its evolution unabated with this Eddie Murphy vehicle that's fast, furious, and funny.
Cast: Eddie Murphy, Judge Reinhold, John Ashton, Lisa Eilbacher
Synopsis: After his childhood buddy is murdered while visiting Detroit, rebellious cop Axel Foley (Eddie Murphy) follows the leads to Beverly...

Title: Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior
Consensus: While Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior may be no great shakes as a movie, critics are hailing the emergence of a new star in Tony Jaa, whose athletic performance is drawing comparisons with Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan, and Jet Li.

Synopsis: In Thailand, the impoverished village of Ban Nong Pradu has its most precious Buddha statue stolen from the temple. Luckily...

Title: Collateral
Consensus: Driven by director Michael Mann's trademark visuals and a lean, villainous performance from Tom Cruise, Collateral is a stylish and compelling noir thriller.

Title: Iron Monkey
Consensus: Iron Monkey may not have the poetic lyricism of Crouching Tiger, it makes up for it in fun and energy.

Title: Escape From New York
Consensus: Featuring an atmospherically grimy futuristic metropolis, Escape from New York is a strange, entertaining jumble of thrilling action and oddball weirdness.
Cast: Kurt Russell, Ernest Borgnine, Adrienne Barbeau, Lee Van Cleef

Title: Battle Royale
Consensus: Battle Royale is a controversial and violent parable of adolescence, heightening teenage melodrama with life-or-death stakes.

Title: Spider-Man 2
Consensus: Boasting an entertaining villain and deeper emotional focus, this is a nimble sequel that improves upon the original.

Title: 13 Assassins

Title: Full Contact
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Consensus: Lighter and more comedic than its predecessor, Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade returns the series to the brisk serial adventure of Raiders, while adding a dynamite double act between Harrison Ford and Sean Connery.

Title: Kung Fu Hustle

Title: A Better Tomorrow
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Title: Iron Man
Consensus: Powered by Robert Downey Jr.'s vibrant charm, Iron Man turbo-charges the superhero genre with a deft intelligence and infectious sense of fun.

Title: The Night Comes for Us

Title: Logan

Title: Goldfinger
Consensus: Goldfinger is where James Bond as we know him comes into focus - it features one of 007's most famous lines ("A martini. Shaken, not stirred.") and a wide range of gadgets that would become the series' trademark.

Title: Assault on Precinct 13
Consensus: Lean, taut and compellingly gritty, John Carpenter's loose update of Rio Bravo ranks as a cult action classic and one of the filmmaker's best.

Title: Wonder Woman
Consensus: Thrilling, earnest, and buoyed by Gal Gadot's charismatic performance, Wonder Woman succeeds in spectacular fashion.

Title: The Chinese Connection
Consensus: No consensus yet.

Title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
Consensus: Suspenseful and politically astute, Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a superior entry in the Avengers canon and is sure to thrill Marvel diehards.

Title: Oldboy
Consensus: Violent and definitely not for the squeamish, Park Chan-Wook's visceral Oldboy is a strange, powerful tale of revenge.
Cast: Choi Min-sik, Yoo Ji-tae, Kang Hye-jung, Ji Dae-han
Synopsis: Dae-Su is an obnoxious drunk bailed from the police station yet again by a friend. However, he's abducted from the...

Title: The French Connection
Consensus: Realistic, fast-paced and uncommonly smart, The French Connection is bolstered by stellar performances by Gene Hackman and Roy Scheider, not to mention William Friedkin's thrilling production.
Cast: Gene Hackman, Fernando Rey, Roy Scheider, Tony Lo Bianco
Synopsis: New York Detective "Popeye" Doyle (Gene Hackman) and his partner (Roy Scheider) chase a French heroin smuggler....

Title: Furious 7
Consensus: Serving up a fresh round of over-the-top thrills while adding unexpected dramatic heft, Furious 7 keeps the franchise moving in more ways than one.
Cast: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Dwayne Johnson, Michelle Rodriguez
Synopsis: After defeating international terrorist Owen Shaw, Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel), Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) and the rest of the crew...

Title: La Femme Nikita
Consensus: A zany out-of-control thriller that gives lead Anne Parillaud a big character arc and plenty of emotional room to work within.
Cast: Anne Parillaud, Jean-Hugues Anglade, Tcheky Karyo, Jeanne Moreau
Synopsis: Convicted felon Nikita (Anne Parillaud), instead of going to jail, is given a new identity and trained to be a...

Title: Supercop
Consensus: Blending hand-to-hand combat with breathtaking stunts and slapstick comedy, Supercop reminds us why Jackie Chan is one of the world's great entertainers.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Michelle Yeaoh, Maggie Cheung, Ken Tsang
Synopsis: To infiltrate a drug cartel, police Inspector Chan Ka Kui (Jackie Chan) goes undercover in a Chinese prison. There, he...

Title: Dirty Harry
Consensus: As tough and taciturn as its no-nonsense hero, Dirty Harry delivers a deceptively layered message without sacrificing an ounce of its solid action impact.
Cast: Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino, Reni Santoni, John Larch
Synopsis: Cop Harry Callahan (Clint Eastwood) attempts to track down a psychopathic rooftop killer before a kidnapped girl dies. When he...

Title: Edge of Tomorrow
Consensus: Gripping, well-acted, funny, and clever, Edge of Tomorrow offers entertaining proof that Tom Cruise is still more than capable of shouldering the weight of a blockbuster action thriller.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Emily Blunt, Brendan Gleeson, Bill Paxton
Synopsis: When Earth falls under attack from invincible aliens, no military unit in the world is able to beat them. Maj....

Title: X2
Consensus: Tightly scripted, solidly acted, and impressively ambitious, X2: X-Men United is bigger and better than its predecessor -- and a benchmark for comic sequels in general.
Cast: Patrick Stewart, Hugh Jackman, Ian McKellen, Halle Berry
Synopsis: Stryker (Brian Cox), a villianous former Army commander, holds the key to Wolverine's (Hugh Jackman) past and the future of...

Title: The Fugitive
Consensus: Exhilarating and intense, this high-impact chase thriller is a model of taut and efficient formula filmmaking, and it features Harrison Ford at his frantic best.
Cast: Harrison Ford, Tommy Lee Jones, Sela Ward, Julianne Moore
Synopsis: Wrongfully accused of murdering his wife, Richard Kimble (Harrison Ford) escapes from the law in an attempt to find her...

Title: Black Panther
Consensus: Black Panther elevates superhero cinema to thrilling new heights while telling one of the MCU's most absorbing stories -- and introducing some of its most fully realized characters.
Cast: Chadwick Boseman, Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong'o, Danai Gurira
Synopsis: After the death of his father, T'Challa returns home to the African nation of Wakanda to take his rightful place...

Title: Inception
Consensus: Smart, innovative, and thrilling, Inception is that rare summer blockbuster that succeeds viscerally as well as intellectually.
Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ellen Page, Tom Hardy
Synopsis: Dom Cobb (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a thief with the rare ability to enter people's dreams and steal their secrets from...

Title: Braveheart
Consensus: Distractingly violent and historically dodgy, Mel Gibson's Braveheart justifies its epic length by delivering enough sweeping action, drama, and romance to match its ambition.
Cast: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan, Catherine McCormack
Synopsis: Tells the story of the legendary thirteenth century Scottish hero named William Wallace (Mel Gibson). Wallace rallies the Scottish against...

Title: Minority Report
Consensus: Thought-provoking and visceral, Steven Spielberg successfully combines high concept ideas and high octane action in this fast and febrile sci-fi thriller.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow
Synopsis: Based on a story by famed science fiction writer Philip K. Dick, "Minority Report" is an action-detective thriller set in...

Title: Avengers: Endgame
Consensus: Exciting, entertaining, and emotionally impactful, Avengers: Endgame does whatever it takes to deliver a satisfying finale to Marvel's epic Infinity Saga.
Cast: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Evans, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Hemsworth
Synopsis: Adrift in space with no food or water, Tony Stark sends a message to Pepper Potts as his oxygen supply...

Title: Dredd
Consensus: Fueled by bombastic violence and impressive special effects, rooted in self-satire and deadpan humor, Dredd 3D does a remarkable job of capturing its source material's gritty spirit.
Cast: Karl Urban, Olivia Thirlby, Lena Headey, Wood Harris
Synopsis: Mega City One is a vast, violent metropolis where felons rule the streets. The only law lies with cops called...

Title: The Bourne Identity
Consensus: Expertly blending genre formula with bursts of unexpected wit, The Bourne Identity is an action thriller that delivers -- and then some.
Cast: Matt Damon, Franka Potente, Chris Cooper, Clive Owen
Synopsis: The story of a man (Matt Damon), salvaged, near death, from the ocean by an Italian fishing boat. When he...

Title: Ip Man
Consensus: At once beholden to the established conventions of the genre and delightfully subversive of them, Ip Man is one of the most exciting -- and refreshingly character-driven -- martial arts films in years.
Cast: Donnie Yen, Simon Yam, Siu-wong Fan, Ka Tung Lam
Synopsis: The life story of Yip Man, the first person to teach the Chinese martial art of Wing Chun....

Title: Face/Off
Consensus: John Travolta and Nicolas Cage play cat-and-mouse (and literally play each other) against a beautifully stylized backdrop of typically elegant, over-the-top John Woo violence.
Cast: John Travolta, Nicolas Cage, Joan Allen, Alessandro Nivola
Synopsis: Obsessed with bringing terrorist Castor Troy (Nicolas Cage) to justice, FBI agent Sean Archer (John Travolta) tracks down Troy, who...

Title: To Live and Die in L.A.
Consensus: With coke fiends, car chases, and Wang Chung galore, To Live and Die in L.A. is perhaps the ultimate '80s action/thriller.
Cast: William L. Petersen, Willem Dafoe, John Pankow, Debra Feuer
Synopsis: When his longtime partner on the force is killed, reckless U.S. Secret Service agent Richard Chance (William L. Petersen) vows...

Title: The Dark Knight
Consensus: Dark, complex, and unforgettable, The Dark Knight succeeds not just as an entertaining comic book film, but as a richly thrilling crime saga.
Cast: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart, Michael Caine
Synopsis: With the help of allies Lt. Jim Gordon (Gary Oldman) and DA Harvey Dent (Aaron Eckhart), Batman (Christian Bale) has...

Title: Mission: Impossible -- Ghost Protocol
Consensus: Stylish, fast-paced, and loaded with gripping set pieces, the fourth Mission: Impossible is big-budget popcorn entertainment that really works.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg, Paula Patton
Synopsis: Blamed for a terrorist attack on the Kremlin, Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) and the entire IMF agency are disavowed by...

Title: Fast Five
Consensus: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.
Cast: Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Jordana Brewster, Tyrese Gibson
Synopsis: Ever since ex-cop Brian O'Conner (Paul Walker) and Mia Torretto (Jordana Brewster) broke her brother Dom (Vin Diesel) out of...

Title: Lethal Weapon
Consensus: The most successful installment in a phenomenally successful series, Lethal Weapon helped redefine action movies for the 1980s and 1990s.
Cast: Mel Gibson, Danny Glover, Gary Busey, Mitchell Ryan
Synopsis: Following the death of his wife, Los Angeles police detective Martin Riggs (Mel Gibson) becomes reckless and suicidal. When he...

Title: The Rock
Consensus: For visceral thrills, it can't be beat. Just don't expect The Rock to engage your brain.
Cast: Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage, Ed Harris, Michael Biehn
Synopsis: FBI chemical warfare expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) is sent on an urgent mission with a former British spy, John...

Title: RoboCop
Consensus: While over-the-top and gory, Robocop is also a surprisingly smart sci-fi flick that uses ultraviolence to disguise its satire of American culture.
Cast: Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox, Daniel O'Herlihy
Synopsis: In a violent, near-apocalyptic Detroit, evil corporation Omni Consumer Products wins a contract from the city government to privatize the...

Title: John Wick: Chapter 2
Consensus: John Wick: Chapter 2 does what a sequel should -- which in this case means doubling down on the non-stop, thrillingly choreographed action that made its predecessor so much fun.
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Common, Laurence Fishburne, Riccardo Scamarcio
Synopsis: Retired super-assassin John Wick's plans to resume a quiet civilian life are cut short when Italian gangster Santino D'Antonio shows...

Title: Casino Royale
Consensus: Casino Royale disposes of the silliness and gadgetry that plagued recent James Bond outings, and Daniel Craig delivers what fans and critics have been waiting for: a caustic, haunted, intense reinvention of 007.
Cast: Daniel Craig, Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench
Synopsis: After receiving a license to kill, British Secret Service agent James Bond (Daniel Craig) heads to Madagascar, where he uncovers...

Title: Baby Driver
Consensus: Stylish, exciting, and fueled by a killer soundtrack, Baby Driver hits the road and it's gone -- proving fast-paced action movies can be smartly written without sacrificing thrills.
Cast: Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey, Lily James, Jon Bernthal
Synopsis: Talented getaway driver Baby (Ansel Elgort) relies on the beat of his personal soundtrack to be the best in the...

Title: Fist of Legend
Consensus: No consensus yet.
Cast: Jet Li, Chin Siu Ho, Billy Chow, Yasuaki Kurata
Synopsis: Chinese martial arts student Chen Zhen (Jet Li) is studying in Kyoto, Japan, when he learns his mentor has died...

Title: The Killer
Consensus: The Killer is another hard-boiled action flick from John Woo featuring eye-popping balletic violence and philosophical underpinnings.

Synopsis: Mob assassin Jeffrey (Chow Yun-Fat) is no ordinary hired gun; the best in his business, he views his chosen profession...

Title: The Raid 2
Consensus: Although its high-energy plot and over-the-top violence may play better with genre aficionados, The Raid 2 definitely delivers more of everything audiences loved about its predecessor.

Synopsis: After surviving a bloody fight with powerful gangsters, rookie Jakarta cop Rama (Iko Uwais) thinks he can resume a normal...

Title: Enter the Dragon
Consensus: Badass to the max, Enter the Dragon is the ultimate kung-fu movie and fitting (if untimely) Bruce Lee swan song.
Cast: Bruce Lee, John Saxon, Jim Kelly, Ahna Capri
Synopsis: Bruce Lee plays a martial-arts expert determined to help capture the narcotics dealer whose gang was responsible for the death...

Title: Commando
Consensus: The ultimate '80s Schwarzenegger movie, replete with a threadbare plot, outsized action, and endless one-liners.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rae Dawn Chong, Dan Hedaya, Vernon Wells
Synopsis: Retired Special Forces soldier John Matrix (Arnold Schwarzenegger) lives with daughter Jenny (Alyssa Milano) in isolation, but his privacy is...

Title: First Blood
Consensus: Much darker and more sensitive than the sequels it spawned, First Blood is a thrilling survival adventure that takes full advantage of Sylvester Stallone's acting skills.

Synopsis: Vietnam veteran and drifter John J. Rambo (Sylvester Stallone) wanders into a small Washington town in search of an old...

Title: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation
Consensus: Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation continues the franchise's thrilling resurgence -- and proves that Tom Cruise remains an action star without equal.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg, Rebecca Ferguson
Synopsis: With the IMF now disbanded and Ethan Hunt (Tom Cruise) out in the cold, a new threat -- called the...

Title: The Terminator
Consensus: With its impressive action sequences, taut economic direction, and relentlessly fast pace, it's clear why The Terminator continues to be an influence on sci-fi and action flicks.

Synopsis: Disguised as a human, a cyborg assassin known as a Terminator (Arnold Schwarzenegger) travels from 2029 to 1984 to kill...

Title: Gladiator
Consensus: Ridley Scott and an excellent cast successfully convey the intensity of Roman gladitorial combat as well as the political intrigue brewing beneath.

Synopsis: Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) takes power and strips rank from Maximus (Russell Crowe), one of the favored generals of his predecessor...

Title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
Consensus: Kill Bill is admittedly little more than a stylish revenge thriller -- albeit one that benefits from a wildly inventive surfeit of style.
Cast: Uma Thurman, Lucy Liu, Vivica A. Fox, Michael Madsen
Synopsis: A former assassin, known simply as The Bride (Uma Thurman), wakes from a coma four years after her jealous ex-lover...

Title: The Professional
Consensus: Pivoting on the unusual relationship between seasoned hitman and his 12-year-old apprentice -- a breakout turn by young Natalie Portman -- Luc Besson's Léon is a stylish and oddly affecting thriller.
Cast: Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman, Danny Aiello
Synopsis: Mathilda (Natalie Portman) is only 12 years old, but is already familiar with the dark side of life: her abusive...

Title: Speed
Consensus: A terrific popcorn thriller, Speed is taut, tense, and energetic, with outstanding performances from Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, and Sandra Bullock.
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Dennis Hopper, Sandra Bullock, Joe Morton
Synopsis: Los Angeles police officer Jack (Keanu Reeves) angers retired bomb squad member Howard Payne (Dennis Hopper) by foiling his attempt...

Title: Drunken Master II
Consensus: Jackie Chan sends up some amazing and entertaining fight sequences in The Legend of Drunken Master.
Cast: Jackie Chan, Ti Lung, Anita Mui, Kar-leung Lau
Synopsis: From a land where honor and tradition reign, comes the legend of a martial-arts hero unlike any other -- the...

Title: John Wick
Consensus: Stylish, thrilling, and giddily kinetic, John Wick serves as a satisfying return to action for Keanu Reeves -- and what looks like it could be the first of a franchise.
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Michael Nyqvist, Alfie Allen, Willem Dafoe
Synopsis: Legendary assassin John Wick (Keanu Reeves) retired from his violent career after marrying the love of his life. Her sudden...

Title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
Consensus: The movie that catapulted Ang Lee into the ranks of upper echelon Hollywood filmmakers, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon features a deft mix of amazing martial arts battles, beautiful scenery, and tasteful drama.

Synopsis: In 19th century Qing Dynasty China, a warrior (Chow Yun-Fat) gives his sword, Green Destiny, to his lover (Michelle Yeoh)...

Title: Predator
Consensus: Predator: Part sci-fi, part horror, part action -- all muscle.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Jesse Ventura, Elpidia Carrillo
Synopsis: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger), a soldier of fortune, is hired by the U.S. government to secretly rescue a group of politicians...

Title: The Bourne Ultimatum
Consensus: The Bourne Ultimatum is an intelligent, finely tuned non-stop thrill ride. Another strong performance from Matt Damon and sharp camerawork from Paul Greengrass make this the finest installment of the Bourne trilogy.
Cast: Matt Damon, Julia Stiles, Joan Allen, David Strathairn
Synopsis: Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) continues his international quest to uncover his true identity. From Russia to Europe to northern Africa...

Title: Total Recall
Consensus: Under Paul Verhoeven's frenetic direction, Total Recall is a fast-paced rush of violence, gore, and humor that never slacks.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Rachel Ticotin, Sharon Stone, Ronny Cox
Synopsis: Douglas Quaid (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is a bored construction worker in the year 2084 who dreams of visiting the colonized Mars....

Title: Mad Max 2
Consensus: The Road Warrior is everything a bigger-budgeted Mad Max sequel with should be: bigger, faster, louder, but definitely not dumber.
Cast: Mel Gibson, Bruce Spence, Emil Minty, Vernon Wells
Synopsis: After avenging the death of his wife and young son at the hands of a vicious gang leader, Max (Mel...

Title: Heat
Consensus: Though Al Pacino and Robert De Niro share but a handful of screen minutes together, Heat is an engrossing crime drama that draws compelling performances from its stars -- and confirms Michael Mann's mastery of the genre.

Synopsis: Master criminal Neil McCauley (Robert De Niro) is trying to control the rogue actions of one of his men, while...

Title: The Raid: Redemption
Consensus: No frills and all thrills, The Raid: Redemption is an inventive action film expertly paced and edited for maximum entertainment.
Cast: Iko Uwais, Joe Taslim, Doni Alamsyah, Yayan Ruhian
Synopsis: A rookie member of an elite team of commandos, Rama (Iko Uwais) is instructed to hang back while his comrades-in-arms...

Title: Mission: Impossible -- Fallout
Consensus: Fast, sleek, and fun, Mission: Impossible - Fallout lives up to the "impossible" part of its name by setting yet another high mark for insane set pieces in a franchise full of them.
Cast: Tom Cruise, Henry Cavill, Ving Rhames, Simon Pegg
Synopsis: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster of epic proportions....

Title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
Consensus: Featuring bravura set pieces, sly humor, and white-knuckle action, Raiders of the Lost Ark is one of the most consummately entertaining adventure pictures of all time.
Cast: Harrison Ford, Karen Allen, Paul Freeman, Wolf Kahler
Synopsis: Dr. Indiana Jones, a renowned archeologist and expert in the occult, is hired by the U.S. Government to find the...

Title: Aliens
Consensus: While Alien was a marvel of slow-building, atmospheric tension, Aliens packs a much more visceral punch, and features a typically strong performance from Sigourney Weaver.
Cast: Sigourney Weaver, Carrie Henn, Michael Biehn, Paul Reiser
Synopsis: After floating in space for 57 years, Lt. Ripley's (Sigourney Weaver) shuttle is found by a deep space salvage team....

Title: Hard-Boiled
Consensus: Boasting impactful action as well as surprising emotional resonance, Hard Boiled is a powerful thriller that hits hard in more ways than one.
Cast: Chow Yun-Fat, Bowie Lam, Philip Chan, Tony Leung Chiu Wai
Synopsis: A cop who loses his partner in a shoot-out with gun smugglers goes on a mission to catch them. In...

Title: The Matrix
Consensus: Thanks to the Wachowskis' imaginative vision, The Matrix is a smartly crafted combination of spectacular action and groundbreaking special effects.
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss, Hugo Weaving
Synopsis: Neo (Keanu Reeves) believes that Morpheus (Laurence Fishburne), an elusive figure considered to be the most dangerous man alive, can...

Title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
Consensus: T2 features thrilling action sequences and eye-popping visual effects, but what takes this sci-fi/ action landmark to the next level is the depth of the human (and cyborg) characters.
Cast: Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong, Robert Patrick
Synopsis: In this sequel set eleven years after "The Terminator," young John Connor (Edward Furlong), the key to civilization's victory over...

Title: Die Hard
Consensus: Its many imitators (and sequels) have never come close to matching the taut thrills of the definitive holiday action classic.
Cast: Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman, Bonnie Bedelia, Reginald VelJohnson
Synopsis: New York City policeman John McClane (Bruce Willis) is visiting his estranged wife (Bonnie Bedelia) and two daughters on Christmas...

Title: Mad Max: Fury Road
Consensus: With exhilarating action and a surprising amount of narrative heft, Mad Max: Fury Road brings George Miller's post-apocalyptic franchise roaring vigorously back to life.
Cast: Tom Hardy, Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Hugh Keays-Byrne
Synopsis: Years after the collapse of civilization, the tyrannical Immortan Joe enslaves apocalypse survivors inside the desert fortress the Citadel. When...
